page.title: 17Fife Iron Works
page.content: {John Carswell}took over{Ferlie's}in{ {1937}after the death of{John Ferlie} who founded it on the same site over{ {120}years ago.{65}people are employed in the{pattern-shop, foundry and {offices}making and selling{castings}of parts for{pumps, gearboxes and {compressors}for water, electricity, gas, ships and desalination plants. In a week they use{30 tonnes}of{steel}and {40 tonnes}of washed{sea-sand.}The sand is mixed with resin and a hardening agent so that when it hardens a{mould is formed into which the{molten iron} may be poured from one of the{4 {electric furnaces.}The men wear safety glasses, helmets, leather clothing and boots as protection against molten steel which reaches{1350C. { 20%}of their output is exported directly to{U.S.A.}but the{80%}sold in the{U.K.}mostly finds its way abroad.
